text.section: The County Council of Dorchester County, by ordinance, may fix and impose a building excise tax on any building construction within Dorchester County.

The County Council shall specify in the ordinance:
The types of building construction subject to the building excise tax;
The criteria and formulas used to assess the tax; and
The tax rates.

section.section: The County Council may impose different rates of the building excise tax on different types of building construction subject to the building excise tax.

The tax rates:
Shall relate to the development or growth-related infrastructure needs in the county; and
May not exceed:
The revenues from the building excise tax shall be deposited in a special fund.

The special fund may only be used for the capital costs of additional or expanded public works, improvements, and facilities required to accommodate new construction or development including:
Emergency services;
Sheriff's offices; and
Schools.

text.section: The building excise tax may be imposed throughout the county, including within municipal corporations.

section.section:
If the building excise tax is imposed within a municipal corporation, the municipal corporation shall assist the county in the collection of the building excise tax by:
Collecting and remitting the tax to the county; or
Requiring the tax be paid to the county in accordance with the terms of the county ordinance.
A municipal corporation that collects the tax and remits the tax to the county may deduct from the revenues collected a fee, not to exceed 2% of the revenues collected, for administrative costs.
